results.title: Autumn: a concept film
results.brief_description: A short experimental film which focuses on one tree as it loses its leaves during the autumn season. We watch until finally the last leaf falls and the tree is completely bare. Without commentary but accompanied with music. No other credits available.

results.title: Wildflower Wonderland
results.brief_description: Informational travelogue on the Grampians National Park focussing mainly on the diversity of flora in and around the area and interspersed with scenes of people bushwalking some of the well-known tracks available.

results.title: Train control
results.brief_description: Shows how the movements of trains on the New South Wales railway system are controlled to ensure smooth running and prevent accidents. When the system has been explained, its working is illustrated by tracing the journey of a goods train from one point to another.

results.title: Wharfies: A History of the Waterside Worker's Federation
results.brief_description: Wharfies traces the history of the Australian Waterside Workers Federation from its foundation in 1902, under Billy Hughes, to the present day. Made in the tradition of the Waterside Workers Film Unit of the 1950s, “Wharfies” covers important historical events including industrial milestones, political crises and the stories of the men themselves. This film is pieced together through dramatised sequences, interviews with veteran wharfies and rare archival footage. Cartoons, news clippings and old photographs all help to tell the story.

results.title: Soldier settlers
results.brief_description: Portrays the progress made since 1945 in the establishment of ex-servicemen from World War II on Victorian land. The division of large estates, the development of existing pastures, the clearing of scrub country and the construction of irrigation channels are seen on representative farms throughout the state. Fruit growing, the dried fruit industry, wheat cultivation and sheep raising, plus dry and irrigated dairying are shown, in addition to the single-unit farm system.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.

results.title: Victoria : The First 150 Years
results.creator_credit: Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.

results.title: Australian gazette. No. 3
results.brief_description: This reel consists of 7 magazine items, including snapshots of the Fitzroy Gardens, a trip to Seal Rock by boat, Kangaroos at Wilson’s Prom, beehives shot in close-up and some prize footage of a motorcycle race on a track around the outside of the Exhibition Buildings. There is also some surprising early experimental filming of Flinders Street, and traffic and crowds on Swanston Street. One amazing shot appears upside-down and then mid-way proceeds to turn upright and show the traffic and people travelling backwards. Footage is then sped up for a cable car ride down a main street. No credits available.
